items.title: Katie Porter Says She ‘Fell Short’ in Viral Video Moments
items.summary: Videos surfaced last week showing the former congresswoman belittling a television reporter and berating an aide. Porter, who is running for California governor, pledged to do better.

items.title: Woman Is Granted a Protective Order Against Representative Cory Mills
items.summary: Representative Cory Mills’s former girlfriend, Lindsey Langston, the reigning Miss United States, told a judge that he had threatened to release sexually explicit videos of her.

items.title: Judge Temporarily Blocks Transfer of Miami Property for Trump Library
items.summary: A judge said that a state college had failed to provide reasonable public notice before taking steps to convey the land it owned.

items.title: ICE Is Cracking Down on Chicago. Some Chicagoans Are Fighting Back.
items.summary: Residents have begun forming volunteer groups to monitor their neighborhoods for federal immigration agents. Others honk their horns or blow whistles when they see agents nearby.

items.title: Trump Awards Charlie Kirk the Presidential Medal of Freedom
items.summary: President Trump presented the medal to Charlie Kirk’s widow, Erika, on what would have been his 32nd birthday.

items.title: Share Your Videos of ICE Interactions
items.summary: The Times is looking for examples of interactions between federal immigration agents and residents across the country.

items.title: Overdose in America – a Guardian Series
items.summary: <p>A series that examines the toll – state by state, county by county – of the US overdose crisis</p><p>This series is supported through philanthropic funding to <a href="https://theguardian.org/">theguardian.org</a>, a US-based foundation that partners with the Guardian on independent editorial projects.</p><p>All of the journalism is editorially independent, commissioned and produced by our Guardian journalists. You can read more about content funding on the Guardian <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/info/2016/jan/25/content-funding">here</a>. A full list of philanthropically supported editorial projects can be found <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/info/2018/oct/02/philanthropic-partnerships-at-the-guardian">here</a>.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/15/overdose-in-america-a-guardian-series">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: ‘The worst of all time’: Trump rails against ‘super bad’ Time magazine cover
items.summary: <p>Despite the glowing story, the cover earned the ire of the US president with criticism of his appearance</p><p>It is a glowing story in a publication Donald Trump has long exalted – but for one catch. The cover picture, the president decreed, “may be the Worst of All Time”.</p><p>Time magazine’s paean to Trump’s role in brokering a <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/09/gaza-ceasefire-deal-trump-biggest-diplomatic-achievement-what-detail">Gaza ceasefire</a>, leading its 10 November issue, was <a href="https://x.com/TIME/status/1977784098929385818">accompanied by a photo</a> of the president taken from below and with the sun behind his head.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/15/history-behind-donald-trump-time-magazine-fury-cover-picture">Continue reading...</a>
